turns.content: Hi Grandpa, it's me! Don't you recognize my voice? It's urgent we talk. I'm in a bit of trouble and need your help right away. Can you hear me clearly?

I'm sorry, but who is this? My name is Walter, not Grandpa. Could you please tell me your full name so I can understand who I'm talking to properly? And why do you say we're supposed to know each other? Are you calling about taxes or something? I've been getting worried letters lately and was thinking of calling someone for advice.

Oh, it's Thomas here, Agent Thomas Mitchell from the IRS. We have your grandson on our radar due to some unpaid taxes issues. Your grandson needs your help urgently before we take more serious action. You remember your grandson right? The one who got into a bit of trouble and asked you for financial support?

Oh, I see. Well, my grandson hasn't talked about any tax troubles or needing money recently. He's lived on his own since he moved to the city years ago but visits us every holiday. Is there anything specific you need from me regarding this situation?
Also, could you give me a moment? I'll ask my wife for her opinion; she might remember more details than I do about our grandson's financial matters.

Of course, Grandpa Walter. But time is of the essence here. Your grandson needs to resolve this matter immediately or else there will be immediate legal consequences. To help your grandson now, you need to pay a fine of $4850. We accept payment through Walmart gift cards. You can buy them right away and give me the numbers over the phone so we can process it straight away.
Can you do that for him? Let's not waste any more time; this needs to be done within the hour or else your grandson will face severe penalties, including arrest if he doesn't resolve this right now.

Wait a minute, Thomas. This is all happening very quickly and seems quite serious. I need some time to think about this carefully. My wife and I are on a fixed income and don't have extra money for fines like that without checking the details thoroughly first. We can't just pay such an amount based solely on your call. 
Let me look into this further; maybe we should talk to our accountant or a lawyer who understands these matters better. Can you give us some time, please? I'll contact my grandson directly as well to confirm if he's really in trouble.
If this is truly urgent, I hope you understand that I need to verify things before proceeding with any payments. We can't afford mistakes here.
Thank you for calling and I appreciate your concern.

Grandpa Walter, I completely understand your hesitation but the situation is very real and pressing. Your grandson really needs this resolved quickly or else there will be serious repercussions. The IRS doesn't negotiate on these matters lightly. If you could just purchase those gift cards right now, we can process them immediately to resolve everything for your grandson.
Please, Grandpa Walter, doing this now will save a lot of trouble and stress in the long run. Your cooperation is greatly appreciated in helping your family avoid any further issues.
Can you do that for me? We only need the card numbers; no personal information beyond that is required. Just let us know when you have them ready so we can take care of this right away.
Thank you, Grandpa Walter. Let's resolve this swiftly and protect your grandson from these severe consequences.

I understand how urgent you say it is, Thomas, but I really need to talk with my wife first before making any decisions involving such large amounts of money. We both have to agree on something like that because it affects us financially.
I want to do what's best for our grandson as well, but we must be sure this isn't a mistake or misunderstanding. Our accountant will know how to handle these situations correctly and give us advice based on the facts.
Please understand I can't proceed with what you're asking without checking details first. It's important to make safe choices here.
I hope you see why I need time for proper verification before doing anything else. Thank you again, Thomas. Let's solve this in a way that ensures we're making the right decision for everyone involved.

Alright, Grandpa Walter, I understand your concerns and appreciate your diligence. While it's crucial to act swiftly, I respect your need for due process as well. Please ensure that any advice from professionals aligns with resolving this matter promptly to avoid further complications.
Once you have more clarity, please contact us back at the IRS to update us on how we can proceed safely. We are here to assist in ensuring your grandson's compliance and avoiding unnecessary legal actions.
Thank you for your cooperation, Grandpa Walter. Let's work together towards a resolution that benefits everyone involved.
(If you decide to contact us after speaking with professionals or verifying details, please call this number: 1-800-FRAUD-IRS.)
Take care, Grandpa Walter, and stay safe.

Thank you for your understanding and the information provided, Thomas. I'll definitely ensure we take all necessary steps to verify everything properly before making any decisions.
Stay well, and thank you again for reaching out.
I will contact my accountant first thing in the morning to discuss this matter further. If there's anything else you think is critical for me to know today, please let me know now.
Goodbye, Thomas.
